page.title: 11 Open Spaces
page.content: Town meets country in the block as a whole so non-housing landuse not surprisingly takes up between 25 and 30 percent of the area. Pasture and arable fields bound the north whilst to the west and north- west very specialised market gardening is very dominant. It is interesting to look through the "yellow pages" at the names of these garden farmers and note names like Baarda and Schelingerhout. And locally the greenhouses are known as "dutch lights" - further evidence to confirm the influx from Holland that occurred in the 1920s. There is a liberal sprinkling of sportsfields though most are privately owned and even the large school fields with a running track are not officially available to the public. Play parks and a mini golf course seemed to be greatly underused on numerous visits.
